DataElementConcept.preferredName: Plan Pheresis Or Bone Marrow Collection Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: To devise, contrive, or form in design._A procedure in which blood is collected, part of the blood such as platelets or white blood cells is taken out, and the rest of the blood is returned to the donor._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
A procedure that collects a component of the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
